column4: hey all, despite having my multiverse lines uncommented in sources.list, I can't seem to see ALL the packages from there. I can see some of them, but I can't see either sun-java6-plugin or sun-java5-plugin. anyone have any idea why I can't see them? The online Ubuntu package index says its in multiverse repos
re you on amd64 ?
yes (intel64 technically, I'm on merom)
http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=4802695
hello
thanks a lot for clearing that up. that's a bit of a huge problem because my work involves developing a java applet.
you can install the 32bit plugin and use it from firefox somehow, theres a guide somewhere
I was just going to ask that. thanks, I'll look for that.
you could try iced-tea
sudo apt-get install icedtea-java7-plugin
do you think that's better than using the gcj plugin?
though that might be in a thirdparty repo
hell yeh :)
forget GCJ exists
so is icedtea some sort of wrapper for legit sun-java? its sort of important that I get the plugin closest to the official one because I need to test my plugin
icedtea is the GPL source for Java7 essentially
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IcedTea
ah I see. now the problem I have is the only packages I can find are for gutsy, but I have hardy. will there be a real problem if I use the gutsy repo?
not sure, try it - you can always remove the packages
the other thing is to do the 32bit install
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=202537
I feel sad for you having to develop applets
